<<<<<<< HEAD
Death triumphant, or, The most renowned, mighty, puissant and irresistible champion and conqueror general of the whole world, Death, described with a descripton [sic] of his notable fights and triumphant victories obtained against all creatures, especially against the sons and daughters of men : also his particular stratagems and numberous regiment of scknesses [sic] and diseases whereby he conquers and subdues mankind : lively set forth to the view of all men for their better preparation for the day of their death and dissolution out of this sinful life / by Andrew Jones. Jones, Andrew.
The fifth edition.
[21] p. : ill.
Printed for Will. Thackeray ..., London : 1674.
Illustrated frontispiece. Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
=======

Jones, Andrew.
The fifth edition.
[21] p. : ill.
Printed for Will. Thackeray ..., London : 1674.
